chapter.title: What is MIPA?
chapter.para: We first briefly introduce context-aware computing. Then we discuss why we need MIPA in building context-aware applications.

sect1.title: Context-aware Computing
sect1.para: Pervasive computing creates environments that embed computation and communication in a way that organically interacts with humans to enhance or ease their daily behavior. Contexts refer to the pieces of information that capture the characteristics of computing environments, and context-awareness allows applications to dynamically adapt to the pervasive computing environment.

sect1.title: PDPC - Property Detection for Pervasive Context
sect1.para: PDPC (Property Detection for Pervasive Context) is one of the primary approaches to achieving context-awareness. Specifically, context-aware applications need to detect whether contexts bear user-specified properties, in order to adapt their behavior accordingly. For example, in a smart office scenario, the user may specify a constraint on property of the contexts: "Location of the user is the lecture room and a presentation is going on in the lecture room". Thus the application can adaptively turn mobile phone of the user to vibration mode when the property is satisfied. Moreover, contexts are often error-prone due to noises. Users may specify properties which accurate contexts must obey, in order to prune noisy contexts. For example, users may specify that: "no one appears in two different places at the same time", to make sure that the location context is correctly collected.

sect1.title: Achieving Context-awareness Based on MIPA in Asynchronous Pervasive Computing Environments
sect1.para: We develop MIPA - the Middleware Infrastructure for Predicate detection in Asynchronous environments - to support PDPC in pervasive computing environments. MIPA aims at supporting the development and deployment of various predicate detection-based context consistency checking schemes for different pervasive computing scenarios.

note.para: MIPA is an open-source middleware currently hosted on Googlecode at http://mipa.googlecode.com/.
